meanings.definition: A headline in a newspaper or magazine that is designed to grab the reader's attention.
meanings.sent1: The scarehead on the front page caught my eye immediately.
meanings.sent2: The newspaper editor chose a bold scarehead for the breaking news story.
meanings.sent3: The scarehead about the missing cat made me chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her scarehead about the upcoming concert was impossible to ignore.
meanings.sent5: The scarehead announcing the new store opening was vibrant and exciting.

meanings.definition: To place a scarehead at the top of a newspaper article to draw attention to it.
meanings.sent1: The journalist decided to scarehead the article to attract more readers.
meanings.sent2: She always scareheads her articles with catchy phrases.
meanings.sent3: I will scarehead my essay with a funny quote to make it stand out.
meanings.sent4: He scareheaded the report with a shocking statistic.
meanings.sent5: The author knew how to scarehead his stories for maximum impact.
